def main():
    s = input()
    pmin = 1000
    mmin = 0
    s = '0' + s

        v = int(c)
        npmin = min(pmin + 10 - (v + 1), mmin + 10 - v)
        nmmin = min(pmin + v + 1, mmin + v)
        pmin = npmin
        mmin = nmmin
    return min(pmin, mmin) Wait, the initial pmin is 1000 (a large number?), mmin is 0. Then, s is prefixed with '0', so the string becomes "0" + original input.     char *stripped_final = malloc(len+1);
    strncpy(stripped_final, start, len);
    stripped_final[len] = '\0';

    // Now check if there are any '1's in stripped_final.
    int has_one = 0;
    for (int i=0; i < len; i++) {
        if (stripped_final[i] == '1') {
            has_one =1;
            break;
        }
    }

    if (!has_one) {
        product =0;
    } else {
        // compute product
        product =1;
        int current_zeros =0;
        for (int i=0; i < len; i++) {
            char c = stripped_final[i];
            if (c == '1') {
                product *= (current_zeros +1);
                current_zeros =0;
            } else {
                if (c == '0') current_zeros++;
            }
        }
        // multiply the last part (after last '1')
        product *= (current_zeros +1);
    }
    free(stripped_final);
}

Alternatively, here's a step-by-step approach for stripping leading and trailing zeros:

Initialize two pointers: start and end.

start points to the first non-zero character in d2_str.

end points to the last non-zero character in d2_str.

If start is beyond end (i.e., all zeros), then the stripped string is empty.

Else, the stripped string is from start to end (inclusive).

So:

char *start = d2_str;
while (*start == '0') start++;

char *end = d2_str + strlen(d2_str) -1;
while (end >= start && *end == '0') end--;

if (start > end) { // all zeros

    product =0;
} else {
    // the stripped string is from start to end (inclusive)
    // now process this substring.

    // check if any '1's in this substring:
    int has_one =0;
    for (char *p = start; p <= end; p++) {
        if (*p == '1') {
            has_one =1;
            break;
        }
    }
    if (!has_one) {
        product =0;
    } else {
        product =1;
        current_zeros =0;
        for (char *p = start; p <= end; p++) {
            char c = *p;
            if (c == '1') {
                product *= (current_zeros +1);
                current_zeros =0;
            } else {
                if (c == '0') current_zeros++;
            }
        }
        // after loop, multiply by current_zeros +1 (the part after last '1')
        product *= (current_zeros +1);
    }
}

The full C code:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    int n;
    scanf("%d", &n); // Ignore n

    char line[1000];
    int sum_a = 0, sum_b = 0, sum_c = 0;

    // Read a's line
    fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin);
    char *token = strtok(line, " \n");
    while (token) {
        sum_a += atoi(token);
        token = strtok(NULL, " \n");
    }

    // Read b's line
    fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin);
    token = strtok(line, " \n");
    while (token) {
        sum_b += atoi(token);
        token = strtok(NULL, " \n");
    }

    // Read c's line
    fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin);
    token = strtok(line, " \n");
    while (token) {
        sum_c += atoi(token);
        token = strtok(NULL, " \n");
    }

    int d1 = abs(sum_a - sum_b);
    int d2 = abs(sum_b - sum_c);

    // Process d2 through File2's logic
    char d2_str[20];
    sprintf(d2_str, "%d", d2);

    char *start = d2_str;
    while (*start == '0') start++;

    char *end = d2_str + strlen(d2_str) - 1;
    while (end >= start && *end == '0') end--;

    int product = 0;
    if (start > end) {
        product = 0;
    } else {
        int has_one = 0;
        for (char *p = start; p <= end; p++) {
            if (*p == '1') {
                has_one = 1;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (!has_one) {
            product = 0;
        } else {
            product = 1;
            int current_zeros = 0;
            for (char *p = start; p <= end; p++) {
                char c = *p;
                if (c == '1') {
                    product *= (current_zeros + 1);
                    current_zeros = 0;
                } else {
                    if (c == '0') current_zeros++;
                }
            }
            product *= (current_zeros + 1);
        }
    }

    // Process product through File3's logic
    char product_str[20];
    sprintf(product_str, "%d", product);
    char s[21];
    strcpy(s, "0");
    strcat(s, product_str);

    int len = strlen(s);
    int pmin = 1000;
    int mmin = 0;

    for (int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
        int v = s[i] - '0';
        int temp1 = pmin + (10 - (v + 1));
        int temp2 = mmin + (10 - v);
        int npmin = (temp1 < temp2) ? temp1 : temp2;

        int temp3 = pmin + (v + 1);
        int temp4 = mmin + v;
        int nmmin = (temp3 < temp4) ? temp3 : temp4;

        pmin = npmin;
        mmin = nmmin;
    }

    int result = (pmin < mmin) ? pmin : mmin;
    printf("%d\n", result);

    return 0;
}
